intro: Matricaria leucanthemum, commonly known as white chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely divided, gray-green leaves and produces white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often cultivated for its aromatic properties and used in herbal teas. Matricaria leucanthemum is also valued in traditional medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory effects.
